Under separate cover we are sending you samples of some of the materials
we regularly send our members, plus other items which will give you more in¬
formation about the Association. Of course, Associate and Affiliate members
do not receive as many of these materials as regularly as Active members do.
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the 1 AEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee. The Network
distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape recording,
weekly, to members subscribing to its service. This fee is also based on
power (with the same power classifications as membership) and a new station
does not have to pay the full fee until the third year it is in the Network.

Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from Net¬
work Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class A station pay¬
ing its full third-year rate is paying only a little over $2.00 an hour for
better than 400 hours of programming from the Network in a year. This is about
the most inexpensive programming a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have further
questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
